etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin gentiana, according to Pliny named after Gentius, king of Illyria, who is said to have discovered the medicinal properties of a common species

definitions: a plant of temperate and mountainous regions, typically with violet or vivid blue trumpet-shaped flowers. Many kinds are cultivated as ornamentals, especially as arctic alpines, and some are of medicinal use.

notes.text: Genera Gentiana and Gentianella, family Gentianaceae: numerous species, including the four-petaled fringed gentian (Gentiana crinita) of North America

shortDefinitions: plant of temperate and mountainous regions

definitions: a tonic liquor formerly extracted from the root of the gentian.
shortDefinitions: tonic liquid substance formerly extracted from root of gentian
